newsitem.title: USA: National Auto Credit to raise $142.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: National Auto Credit to raise $142.5 mln.

text.p: National Auto Credit Inc on Thursday said it completed a previously announced private debt offering and would issue $45 million of 7.66 percent unsecured senior notes with an average term of five years.

National Auto, a provider of cash advances to dealers in the used-car industry, also said it entered into an $97.5 million unsecured revolving credit agreement, with a three-year and a one-year tranche.
The facility was co-agented by First National Bank of Chicago and J.P. Morgan.
It said proceeds from the senior note offering and the revolving credit facility will provide the company with the funds to meet the planned growth of its receivables portfolio.
